00006 /* Funzioni per l'accesso alla FLASH BPI */
00007 /*******************************************************************/

00009 /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
00010 /* offset deve essere allineato a 16 bit (BIT0 non significativo) */
00011 int bpi_flash_read(int32_t dev, uint32_t offset, uint32_t* bpi_data) {
00012         uint32_t app_data;
00013 
00014         //Imposto indirizzo
00015         app_data = offset << 1;
00016         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_AD | 0x1000, app_data);
00017 
00018         //Abbasso il CE
00019         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x6);
00020 
00021         //Abbasso OE
00022         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x2);
00023 
00024         //Rialzo OE
00025         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x6);
00026 
00027         //Alzo CE
00028         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x7);
00029 
00030         //Sono significativi, per la lettura, solo i 16 bit bassi
00031         CAENVME_ReadRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_DT | 0x1000, &app_data);
00032         *bpi_data = app_data & 0x0000FFFF;
00033 
00034         return 0;
00035 }
00036 
00037 /*-------------------------------------------------------------*/
00038 int bpi_flash_write(int32_t dev, uint32_t offset, uint32_t bpi_data) {
00039         uint32_t data;
00040 
00041         //Imposto indirizzo
00042         data = offset << 1;
00043 
00044         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_AD | 0x1000, data);
00045 
00046         //Imposto il dato
00047         //Per la scrittura i 16 bit da scrivere vanno messi nella parte alta del registro.
00048         data = bpi_data << 16;
00049         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_DT | 0x1000, data);
00050 
00051         //Abbasso il CE
00052         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x6);
00053 
00054         //Abbasso WE
00055         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x4);
00056 
00057         //Rialzo WE
00058         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x6);
00059 
00060         //Alzo CE
00061         CAENVME_WriteRegister(dev, A3818_BPI_FLASH_CMD | 0x1000, 0x7);
00062 
00063         return 0;
00064 }
00065 
00066 // abilito la BPI flash
00067 void A3818_EnableBPIAccess(int32_t handle) {
00068         uint32_t data;
00069         CAENVME_ReadRegister(handle, A3818_DMISCCS | 0x1000, &data);
00070         data = data | A3818_DMISCCS_SPI_BPI_FLASH_SEL;
00071         CAENVME_WriteRegister(handle, A3818_DMISCCS | 0x1000, data);
00072 }
00073 
00074 // Disabilita l'accesso alla BPI flash.
00075 // L'a3818 può accedere alla sola flash SPI.
00076 void A3818_EnableSPIAccess(int32_t handle) {
00077         uint32_t data;
00078         CAENVME_ReadRegister(handle, A3818_DMISCCS | 0x1000, &data);
00079         data = data & (~A3818_DMISCCS_SPI_BPI_FLASH_SEL);
00080         CAENVME_WriteRegister(handle, A3818_DMISCCS | 0x1000, data);
00081 }

00083 /****************************************************************************/
00084 
00085 // Lettura registro di stato e controllo che la flash sia ready
00086 static uint32_t readFlashStatus(int32_t dev) {
00087 
00088         uint32_t stat;
00089         bpi_flash_write(dev, 0x0, P30_READ_STATUS);
00090         bpi_flash_read(dev, 0x0, &stat);
00091 
00092         return stat;
00093 
00094 }
00095 
00096 /****************************************************************************
00097  *
00098  * waitUntilReady
00099  *
00100  * Description:
00101  *
00102  *    This procedure is called to wait until the flash device status
00103  *    indicates a ready state or times out.  See the flash device datasheet
00104  *    for specific details on reading status data.
00105  *
00106  * Parameters:
00107  *
00108  *    IN      timeout  - timeout value specified as number of times
00109  *                       to read the status register before giving up.
00110  *
00111  * Returns:
00112  *
00113  *    uint8_t         - boolean flag indicating whether the ready state was
00114  *                     reached before the timeout number of reads
00115  *                     occured.
00116  *
00117  * Assumptions:
00118  *
00119  *    NONE.
00120  *
00121  ***************************************************************************/
00122 static uint8_t waitUntilReady(int32_t dev, uint32_t timeout) {
00123 
00124         while (timeout) {
00125 
00126                 if (mIsStatusReady( readFlashStatus(dev) )) {
00127                         return (TRUE);
00128                 }
00129                 timeout--;
00130         }
00131 
00132         return (FALSE);
00133 
00134 }
00135 
00136 static int eraseBlock(int32_t dev, uint32_t blockAddress) {
00137 
00138         uint32_t status;
00139 
00140         waitUntilReady(dev, 0xFFFFFFFF);
00141 
00142         // Unlock Command
00143         bpi_flash_write(dev, blockAddress, P30_BLOCK_LOCK_SETUP);
00144         bpi_flash_write(dev, blockAddress, P30_BLOCK_UNLOCK);
00145 
00146         //Erase
00147         bpi_flash_write(dev, blockAddress, P30_BLOCK_ERASE_SETUP);
00148         bpi_flash_write(dev, blockAddress, P30_BLOCK_ERASE_CONFIRM);
00149 
00150         // Attesa ready della flash
00151         waitUntilReady(dev, 0xFFFFFFFF);
00152 
00153         status = readFlashStatus(dev);
00154         bpi_flash_write(dev, 0x0, P30_CLEAR_STATUS);
00155 
00156         // Imposto Read Array Mode
00157         bpi_flash_write(dev, 0x0, P30_READ_ARRAY);
00158 
00159         return status;
00160 }
00161 
00162 /****************************************************************************
00163  *
00164  * writeFlashPage
00165  *
00166  * Description:
00167  *
00168  * Funzioni per la scrittura/lettura di pagine della flash StrataFlash Numonix P30
00169  * montata sulla A3818.
00170  * Riferimento: Buffer Program Flowchart (fig. 36) da datasheet
00171  *    Numonyx Strataflash Embedded memory P30 (306666-12 - Agosto 2008).
00172  *
00173  * Parameters:
00174  *  
00175  *    IN      dev    - A3818 driver handle
00176  *
00177  *    IN      data   - the buffer containing data to be programmed.
00178  *
00179  *    IN      wordAddress  - the flash address to be programmed.
00180  *
00181  *    IN      numwords - the number of words (ie two bytes) of data contained in the buffer.
00182  *                                This is a X16 write buffer routine and the part expects a count in # of words
00183  *
00184  * Returns:
00185  *    
00186  *    int    TBD
00187  * 
00188  * Assumptions:
00189  *
00190  *    NONE
00191  *
00192  ***************************************************************************/
00193 static int writeFlashPage(int32_t dev, uint32_t *data, int wordAddress,
00194                 int numWords) {
00195         int i;
00196 
00197         // La modalit� di scrittura con buffer ha un massimo di 32 word a 16 bit
00198         // che possono essere scritte.
00199         if (numWords > 32)
00200                 return -1;
00201 
00202         // Imposto Read Array Mode
00203         bpi_flash_write(dev, 0x0, P30_READ_ARRAY);
00204 
00205         // Status check
00206         waitUntilReady(dev, 0xFFFFFFFF);
00207 
00208         bpi_flash_write(dev, wordAddress, P30_BUFFERED_PROGRAM);
00209         bpi_flash_write(dev, wordAddress, numWords - 1); // N=16 words da scrivere (bisogna scrivere N-1)
00210 
00211         for (i = wordAddress; i < (wordAddress + numWords); ++i) {
00212                 bpi_flash_write(dev, i, data[i - wordAddress]);
00213         }
00214 
00215         bpi_flash_write(dev, wordAddress, P30_BUFFERED_PROGRAM_CONFIRM);
00216 
00217         // Status check
00218         waitUntilReady(dev, 0xFFFFFFFF);
00219 
00220         // Imposto Read Array Mode
00221         bpi_flash_write(dev, 0x0, P30_READ_ARRAY);
00222 
00223         return 0;
00224 }
00225 
00226 int readFlash(int32_t dev, uint32_t *data, int address, int length) {
00227         int flash_addr;
00228         int i;
00229 
00230         // Imposto Read Array Mode
00231         bpi_flash_write(dev, 0x0, P30_READ_ARRAY);
00232 
00233         flash_addr = address;
00234         for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
00235                 bpi_flash_read(dev, flash_addr + i, &data[i]);
00236         }
00237 
00238         return 0;
00239 }
00240 
00241 unsigned int verifyFlash(uint32_t handle, uint32_t *buffer,
00242                 uint32_t bufferLength, uint32_t startWordAddress) {
00243         int finish, i;
00244         unsigned int verify_err;
00245         int bp, wc, pp;
00246         uint32_t bpi_rd[32]; // 16-bit word read from flash
00247 
00248         wc = 0; // byte counter
00249 
00250 
00251         bp = 0; // byte pointer in the page
00252         finish = 0; // it goes high when eof is found
00253         verify_err = 0; // number of errors during verify
00254 
00255         pp = 0;
00256 
00257         while (wc < bufferLength) {
00258 
00259 #ifdef PRINT_POINTS
00260                 if (((wc % (32 * 1024)) == 0) || finish) {
00261                         printf(".");
00262                         fflush(stdout);
00263                 }
00264 #endif                             
00265                 readFlash(handle, bpi_rd, (pp * 32) + startWordAddress, 32); // read page
00266 
00267                 for (i = 0; i < 32; i++) { // verify page
00268                         if (bpi_rd[i] != buffer[wc + i]) {
00269                                 printf("page = %d; bpi_rd[%d]=%04X, buffer[%d]=%04X  \n", pp,
00270                                                 i, bpi_rd[i], wc + i, buffer[wc + i]);
00271                                 printf("\n\n Writing or Verify error at page %d - %d\n", pp, i);
00272                                 ++verify_err;
00273                         }
00274                 }
00275                 bp = 0;
00276                 pp++;
00277                 wc += 32;
00278         } // end of while loop
00279 
00280 
00281         return verify_err;
00282 
00283 }

00285 // L'immagine del firmware dell'A3818 � di circa 1716 KB
00286 int eraseFirmware(uint32_t handle, uint32_t baseAddress, uint32_t fwcopy) {
00287         int i;
00288 
00289         if (fwcopy == 0) {
00290                 // Cancella i primi 4 blocchi da 32KB = 128KB
00291                 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
00292                         eraseBlock(handle, baseAddress + (i * (16 * 1024)));
00293 #ifdef PRINT_POINTS
00294 
00295                         printf(".");
00296                         fflush(stdout);
00297 #endif             
00298                 }
00299                 // Cancella 13 blocchi da 128KB
00300                 for (i = 4; i < 18; i++) {
00301                         eraseBlock(handle, baseAddress + ((i - 3) * (64 * 1024)));
00302 #ifdef PRINT_POINTS             
00303                         printf(".");
00304                         fflush(stdout);
00305 #endif             
00306                 }
00307         } else {
00308                 // Cancella 15 blocchi da 128KB = cancella 15*128K = 1920KB
00309                 for (i = 0; i < 14; i++) {
00310                         eraseBlock(handle, baseAddress + (i * (64 * 1024)));
00311 #ifdef PRINT_POINTS             
00312                         printf(".");
00313                         fflush(stdout);
00314 #endif             
00315                 }
00316         }
00317 
00318         // Ritorna in modalit� Read Array Mode
00319         bpi_flash_write(handle, 0x0, P30_READ_ARRAY);
00320         return 0;
00321 }
00322 
00323 void writeFlash(uint32_t handle, uint32_t *buffer, uint32_t bufferLength,
00324                 uint32_t startWordAddress) {
00325 
00326         int wc, pp;
00327 
00328         wc = 0;
00329         pp = 0;
00330 
00331 #ifdef PRINT_POINTS        
00332         printf(".");
00333         fflush(stdout);
00334 #endif        
00335         while (wc < bufferLength) {
00336 #ifdef PRINT_POINTS             
00337                 if (((wc % (32 * 1024)) == 0)) {
00338                         printf(".");
00339                         fflush(stdout);
00340                 }
00341 #endif                      
00342                 writeFlashPage(handle, buffer + (pp * 32),
00343                                 startWordAddress + (pp * 32), 32);
00344 
00345                 pp++;
00346                 wc += 32;
00347         } // end of while loop
00348 
00349 }
